source: A password required by the SMTP server (leave blank if not required)
A password required by the SMTP server.
A password required by the SMTP server. The currently set password is hidden for security reasons.
A username + password required by the SMTP server.
A username required by the SMTP server (leave blank if not required)
A username required by the SMTP server.

An alternative plain text version can be generated based on the HTML version if no plain text version
        has been explicitly set. The plain text version will be used by e-mail clients not capable of displaying HTML content.
An attempt has been made to send an e-mail to @email.

An attempt to send an e-mail message failed, and the following error message was returned : @exception_message

The e-mail carried the following headers:

@headers
Configure Swift Mailer transport and message settings.
Configure how Swift Mailer will compose messages.
Configure how Swift Mailer will send e-mails.
Drupal has been configured to send all e-mails using the SMTP transport type.
Drupal has been configured to send all e-mails using the Sendmail transport type.
Drupal has been configured to send all e-mails using the Spool transport type.

E-mails need to carry details about the character set which the
        receiving client should use to understand the content of the e-mail.
        The default character set is UTF-8.
Installs Swift Mailer as a mail system.
Not sure which option to choose? Go with bs. You can read more about the above two modes in the @documentation.
Not sure which transport type to choose? The @documentation gives you a good overview of the various transport types.
Please refer to @link for more details about how the alternative plain text version will be generated.

Select the content type. This module will convert content if necessary. The Keep existing option is less recommended because many applications do not set the existing content type reliably. Some applications (including Simplenews newsletter) allow case-by-case configuration of content type that overrides this value.
Send a test e-mail to verify that the configuration works.
Swift Mailer SMTP credentials with Key Module
Swift Mailer SMTP credentials with Key Module (user/password keys)
Swift Mailer has been successfully configured!
Swift Mailer requires the external Swift Mailer library. The recommended way of solving this dependency is using the Composer Manager module.
Text format to use when converting a plain text e-mail to HTML.
The Swift Mailer library is no longer maintained.

The Swift Mailer module is designed to replace the default mail system that is shipped with Drupal. The initial configuration of this is done through the Mail System module. Swift Mailer allows you to choose how e-mails should be sent. To read more about how this module works, please have a look at the Swift Mailer documentation.
The absolute path to the locally installed MTA.
The absolute path to the spool directory.
The hostname or IP address at which the SMTP server can be reached.
target: Der Hostname oder IP-Adresse des SMTP Servers.

source: The invalid "From" e-mail address "@mail" was skipped.
The invalid "To" e-mail address "@mail" was skipped.
The list of available formats is restricted to those that escape HTML.
The port at which the SMTP server can be reached (defaults to 25)
target: Die Portnummer unter der der SMTP Server erreichbar ist (standardmäßig 25)

source: The type of encryption which should be used (if any)
This e-mail has been sent from @site by the Swift Mailer module. The module has been successfully configured.
target: Diese E-Mail wurde vom Swift Mailer Modul auf @site verschickt. Die Konfiguration des Moduls ist damit erfolgreich abgeschlossen.

source:
This page allows you to configure how e-mail messages are formatted.
        The Default PHP mailer can only send plain text e-mails. This module can send HTML e-mails if you
        use the recommended settings below.
This page allows you to configure settings which determines how e-mail messages are sent.
This page allows you to send a test e-mail to a recipient of your choice.
target: Diese Seite ermöglicht das Verschicken einer Test-E-Mail an einen selbstgewählten Empfänger.

source:
This transport does not attempt to send the email
    but instead saves the message to a spool file. Another process can then
    read from the spool and take care of sending the emails.

This transport type will send all e-mails using a SMTP
      server of your choice. You need to specify which SMTP server
      to use. Please refer to the @documentation for more details
      about this transport type.

This transport type will send all e-mails using a locally
      installed MTA such as Sendmail. You need to specify which
      locally installed MTA to use by providing a path to the
      MTA. If you do not provide any path then Swift Mailer
      defaults to /usr/sbin/sendmail. You can read more about
      this transport type in the @documentation.
Which transport type should Drupal use to send e-mails?
You can send a test e-mail to a recipient of your choice. The e-mail will be sent using the default values as provided by the Swift Mailer module or as configured by you.
